intro: Ludwigia rigida, commonly known as the rigid Ludwigia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Onagraceae. It is native to parts of South America, particularly Brazil, and is often found in wetland environments. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Ludwigia rigida is often cultivated as an ornamental plant in aquatic or bog gardens due to its aesthetic appeal and adaptability to moist conditions.
